item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:1, topic:457794”]Okay well I need some assistance and malwarebytes forums were not sure either so I am going to ask here cause well…yeah…

past couple of days I have noticed that whenever my modem resets I see for a moment a different network connection that shows the same signal strength as my wifi connection called “phat boy and thin mint” when my connection is named something else.

The other network disappears after a second so I assume it couldn’t connect to my pc. I am still wondering how I can stop that name showing. Whenever I go to the network center though to try to “delete” or to “block” that connection it isn’t there by that point cause like I said it stops showing after a few moments.

So in conclusion I am wondering if I still have a partial rat connection somehow. If so, how do I get rid of it? What do I need look for? Not that I would expect an anti virus software or anything to be able to catch it but I have used both avg sbs and mcafee 8.5i and neither have picked up anything.

I haven’t downloaded anything in the past 3-4 days so it’s not like I was infected somehow. I believe it may be from a former infection and the person may found a new way to re-activate a hidden file or something? I don’t know. Any help will be gladly accepted.

I’m not comfortable getting on RuneScape until this is resolved.[/quote]

Thin Mint

Is a member of a R.S.P.S. community. I highly doubt they’re involved.

Read full topic

item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @kleber883 kleber883
item.description:
@kleber883 wrote:

Alrighty I will try to find a license for a paid version and update post later got to go for a while thanks for the info. And I didn’t know phat meant fat boy sorry

Erhm, I’m not sure if this breaks rules, but I’m not posting a specific link to anything…
Go to google and search “avast internet security tpb” and the first link from pirate bay has TIMETHIEF’s release, and I’ve used that one before. It’s clean.

If I recall correctly, you’ve posted some helpful stuff on my topics/threads.

Keep us updated!

item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @kleber883 kleber883
item.description:
@kleber883 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:1, topic:457809”]that’s the thing david I have checked the processes nothing is being ran. It’s only when I go to connect I see it for a second.

I live semi in the country so the nearest house to me is about maybe 50 25-30 yards across the street.

Also, I doubt anybody would name a connection “phat” nobody in my neighborhood plays runescape as far as i know.[/quote]

Download avast…? It has a section where you can monitor all incoming and outgoing connections, even if they’re only for a second. That should help you pinpoint the problem… IDK if that’s the paid version or not though… I suppose you could always .torrent it…

Read full topic
